channel.title: London on Shweata's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in London on Shweata's Blog

item.title: Places Visited 2025 | UK Edition
item.description:
I have seen more of London than any other city. Cambridge comes close second. Here is a dyanmic list of places I have visited so far in 2025. The list includes universities, cafes, stores, etc. Not too common ones like M&S, of course. Hopefully, this list grows more in the coming year.

September 2025

  1. Brixton Market and Village, Brixton
  2. Natural History Museum, South Kensington
  3. Science Museum, South Kensington
  4. Imperial College London, South Kensington (of course!)
  5. Brixton library, Brixton

October 2025

  1. South Kensington Bookstore, South Kensington
  2. Muji, Oxford Circus
  3. Uniqlo, Oxford Circus
  4. Anasuya’s place, Catford
  5. The bar, King’s Cross St Pancras
  6. Peter’s place, Cambridge (finally!)
  7. The Plough, Fen Ditton via River Cam
  8. Francis Crick Institute, King’s Cross (Hasok Chang’s talk)
  9. ExCeL London (Chevening Orientation)
  10. Big Ben, London
  11. London Eye, London
  12. London Bridge, London
  13. Goodenough College, Russell Square
  14. University College London, Euston (Open Access Week event)
  15. Barbican Theatre, City of London (T.M Krishna’s concert!)
  16. London School of Economics (Public Understanding of Science Talk)
  17. University of London Student Bar (Blah Halloween)

November 2025

  1. Sloane Square (Parliament Choir)
  2. Hammersmith (Riverside pubs: The Old City Arms, William Morris, The Dove)
  3. BBC Studios
  4. Oxford Circus (featuring Christmas lights)
  5. Locarno Suite, FCDO, Westminister
  6. Royal Albert Hall, South Kensignton (with Peter!)
  7. Harry Potter store, King’s Cross
  8. EMBL-EBI, Hinxton
  9. Pergola, Brixton
  10. The Ship, Westminster (Schrondinger’s Chats)
  11. The Medici Gallery, South Kensington
  12. Waterstones, Picadilly (best book store ever!)

December 2025

  1. The Department Store, Brixton
  2. The Wellcome Library, Euston
  3. Smith Square Hall, Westminster
  4. The Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge
  5. The Technology Museum, Cambridge
  6. The Wren Library, Trinity College
  7. Quaker’s Meeting Room, Cambridge
  8. The Whipple Museum of History of Science, Cambridge
  9. Cambridge Botanic Gardens, Cambridge
